title: Hierarchical Breakdown of /usr and /var in Ubuntu 22.04
context: Exploring how Ubuntu organizes user binaries, libraries, logs, and variable data across /usr and /var.
keyIdea: /usr contains mostly static executables and shared resources; /var holds variable data that changes during system operation. Understanding both is key for maintenance, backups, and troubleshooting.
commands:
# Explore /usr and /var with depth 2
sudo tree -L 2 /usr /var

# Check disk usage per subdirectory
sudo du -sh /usr/* /var/*

# View service state directories
ls /var/lib | sort
explanation: /usr is read-mostly, standardized for all users and applications. /var is writable, containing transient and persistent data created by services. System administrators monitor /var/log and /var/lib closely for performance and state consistency.

reusabilityNotes.whenToReuse: When planning filesystem layouts, troubleshooting services, or cleaning up disk space.
reusabilityNotes.pitfalls: Avoid deleting files in /var/lib or /var/spool directlyâ€”use service tools instead (e.g., systemctl, apt clean).
